Boronnitride

class conan.build_modules.structures.Boronnitride(bond_distance: float, sheet_size: Tuple[float, float])

Bases: Structure2d

Represents a boron nitride sheet structure. This differs from the Graphene class by composition, stacking of sheets (AA’ instead of ABA) and type of pores (triangular instead of circular)

Methods

__init__(bond_distance, sheet_size)

Initializes a Structure2D instance.

add(parameters)

Adds a functional group to the structure.

available_positions()

Gets the available positions on the sheet.

functionalize_sheet(parameters)

Functionalizes the sheet with functional groups.

make_pores(parameters, keywords)

Creates pores in the boron nitride sheet.

print_xyz_file(file_name)

Prints the structure to an XYZ file.

remove_atom_by_index(index)

Removes an atom from the structure by its index.

rotation_matrix_from_vectors(vec1, vec2)

Computes a rotation matrix to align the first vector (vec1, defaulting to the z-axis [0, 0, 1]) with a second vector (vec2).

stack(parameters, keywords)

Stacks multiple structures based on the provided parameters.

Attributes

type

_build_sheet() → None

Builds the boron nitride sheet from multiple unit cells.

Boron nitride sheets are composed of alternating boron (B) and nitrogen (N) atoms arranged in a hexagonal lattice. This method constructs such a sheet by replicating the defined unit cell across specified dimensions.

Parameters

None

Returns

None

_make_triangular_pore(parameters: Dict[str, str | int | float], keywords: List[str]) → None

Creates a triangular pore in the boron nitride sheet.

Parameters

parametersDict[str, Union[str, int, float]]

Must contain “pore_size” parameter. Optionally can also contain the ‘position’ parameter for specific placement on the sheet.

keywordsList[str]

Additional keyword arguments for pore creation. Currently there are none, will be added later once more options are implemented.

Returns

None

_stack_sheets(parameters: Dict[str, str | int | float]) → None

Stacks multiple instances of graphene sheets based on the provided parameters.

Parameters

parameters (Dict[str, Union[str, int, float]]): must contain interlayer_spacing and number_of_layers parameters. keywords (List[str]): Currently none available.

Returns

None

make_pores(parameters: Dict[str, str | int | float], keywords: List[str]) → None

Creates pores in the boron nitride sheet.

For now, only contains triangular pore creation. More options will be added soooon™.

Parameters

parametersDict[str, Union[str, int, float]]

Must contain the ‘pore_size’ parameter. Optionally can also contain the ‘position’ parameter for specific placement on the sheet.

keywordsList[str]

May contain the all_sheets keyword to make a pore at the selected position through the whole stack of sheets (if one exists).

Returns

None
